abstract: The dismissals continue the years-long turmoil in AOL’s top ranks. The new chairman and chief executive will be Tim Armstrong.
snippet: The dismissals continue the years-long turmoil in AOL’s top ranks. The new chairman and chief executive will be Tim Armstrong.
lead_paragraph: Time Warner abruptly fired the two top leaders of its struggling AOL unit Wednesday and replaced them with one of the top executives from Google.

headline.main: Executive From Google to Replace Two at AOL
headline.print_headline: Executive From Google To Replace Two at AOL

abstract: Time Warner abruptly fired the two top leaders of its struggling AOL unit Wednesday and replaced them with one of the top executives from Google, The New York Times’s Saul Hansell reported.
lead_paragraph: Time Warner abruptly fired the two top leaders of its struggling AOL unit Wednesday and replaced them with one of the top executives from Google, The New York Times’s Saul Hansell reported.

headline.main: Executive From Google to Replace Two at AOL

abstract: Former Googler Dennis Crowley unveiled Foursquare, a location-based mobile application that awards points for pub crawling and other activities, at the South by Southwest festival.
snippet: Former Googler Dennis Crowley unveiled Foursquare, a location-based mobile application that awards points for pub crawling and other activities, at the South by Southwest festival.
lead_paragraph: Dennis Crowley’s last big project, a location-based messaging service called Dodgeball, was just shut down by its owner, Google.

headline.main: Foursquare Seeks to Turn Nightlife Into a Game

abstract: Time Warner‘s decision to toss out two AOL leaders and recruit a former Google executive has one analyst saying that an AOL spinoff seems much more likely.
snippet: Time Warner‘s decision to toss out two AOL leaders and recruit a former Google executive has one analyst saying that an AOL spinoff seems much more likely.
lead_paragraph: Speculating about the fate of AOL is a constant exercise in tea-leaf reading — and as tea leaves go, this was a big one: Time Warner on Thursday tossed out two top leaders at its AOL unit, and brought in a former Google executive instead.

headline.main: New AOL Chief Fuels Talk of Spinoff

abstract: Tim Armstrong, who now will run AOL, was the chief salesman at Google. But he was more than just a suit — he helped make the search engine the most powerful force in marketing.
snippet: Tim Armstrong, who now will run AOL, was the chief salesman at Google. But he was more than just a suit — he helped make the search engine the most powerful force in marketing.
lead_paragraph: Update | 2:09 p.m.   Anecdote about the early ad sales modified.

headline.main: This Suit Just Might Save AOL
